posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Our team is going to convert our continuous elevator to cascade. We are hoping to make our elevator faster by doing this. We are using PID control, but would like to switch to MAXMotion to make our elevator reach setpoints more accurately and less violently. We haven’t done this before, so we are hoping to get some insight before we start. Thanks!

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: Don’t.  You’ll do better using a motion profile on the RIO with a decent feedforward.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: What is the problem with MAXMotion? Is it inconsistent or not effective?

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: It doesn’t use kF sensibly and it doesn’t expose the current profile setpoint, so the only feedforward it supports is a constant gravity compensation voltage.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.cooked: im so sad this has become the default response to questions about max motion. never before have i been so offended by something i 100% agree with. i was really excited when i first heard about max motion. my disappointment is immeasurable, and my day is ruined.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: Yeah it’s quite disappointing that it’s 2025 and the REV on-controller motion profiling is still a trap.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.cooked: im hopeful for their next attempt. third time’s the charm

posts.name: Will Toth
posts.cooked: Fortunately the examples that WPILib puts out for the various profiles are pretty decent, and allow you to customize however you want.
yup maxmotion violated its constraints and oscillated unacceptably for us, don’t use it
